intro: Zygocarpum somalense, commonly known as the Somali starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Horn of Africa. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped fruits. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptability to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are alternate and pinnately compound, while the flowers are small and yellowish in color. The fruit, which is edible, develops from the flower and is often used in local cuisines.
